Name: Panic buttons for drivers of taxicabs, street hail liveries and for-hire vehicles.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to panic buttons for drivers of taxicabs, street hail liveries and for-hire vehicles

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Summary: This bill would require taxis, street hail liveries and for-hire vehicles to have panic buttons within reach of the driver to notify the Police Department when the driver is in distress.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section 19-508 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision d to read as follows:
      d. 1. For purposes of this section, the term "panic button" means a help or distress signaling system as designated by the rules of the commission that connects a driver in distress with the police department.
      2. Every taxicab, HAIL vehicle and for-hire vehicle shall have a panic button within reach of the driver's seat. 
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes a law, except that the taxi and limousine commission shall take such measures as are necessary for the implementation of this local law, including the promulgation of rules, prior to such date.
